definition: Scientific disciplines that study living organisms, their processes, and their interactions with the environment.

positive_examples: The biology professor explained how photosynthesis converts sunlight into energy.
Veterinarians need extensive training in animal physiology and disease treatment.
Medical researchers are studying the biochemical pathways involved in cancer.
The botany field trip focused on identifying native plant species.
Zoologists observed the mating behaviors of various bird species.
Physiological studies revealed how the heart responds to exercise.
negative_examples: The physicist calculated the trajectory of the satellite using quantum mechanics.
Chemical engineers optimized the industrial synthesis of polymers.
Geologists analyzed rock formations to understand Earth's history.
The computer scientist developed new algorithms for machine learning.
Astronomers discovered a new exoplanet in a distant solar system.
Environmental engineers designed systems to reduce industrial pollution.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: PhysicalSciences, Chemistry, Engineering, ComputerScience, Mathematics
